page.topic: Dynamically Set and Change Buttons in a ControlBar Button-list

section.title: Create a Button to Dynamically Set Buttons in a ControlBar Button-List

step.description: In the UX Builder open the UX Controls page. In the toolbar check the 'Mobile' checkbox.
Open the Panels menu and select the [Panel Card] option to add a Panel Card to the component.
Highlight the Panel Card and open the 'Containers' menu. Click on the [Container] option.
From the 'Container Type' list select the 'PanelHeader' option and click 'Insert After'.
Highlight the PanelHeader. Open the 'Other Controls' property and click on the [ControlBar] option to add a control-bar to the PanelHeader.
Highlight the ControlBar. In the properties list on the right click the [...] button next to the 'ControlBar properties' property to open the ControlBar Builder.
On the ControlBar Builder's 'Items' pane click the 'Add ControlBar Item' button.
From the 'Item Type' choices select 'button-list' and click OK.
In the ControlBar Item Properties click the [...] button next to the 'Button-list Settings' property, in the Button-List Settings section.
Click the 'Add Button' button.
In the 'HTML' textbox type 'Button 1'. Set the 'Value' to be 'b1' and click OK.
Click the 'Add Button' button.
In the 'HTML' textbox type 'Button 2'. Set the 'Value' to be 'b2' and click OK.
Click the 'Add Button' button.
In the 'HTML' textbox type 'Button 3'. Set the 'Value' to be 'b3' and click OK.
In the Button-List Builder's 'Optional' menu set the Variable name to be 'mybuttonlist'. Click OK to close the Button-List Builder.
In the ControlBar Item Properties list's Button-List Settings section check the 'Fill width' checkbox.
step.note: This will cause the buttons that were just added to fill the width of the entire panel header once the ControlBar Layout is defined.

step.description: Open the 'ControlBar Layout' pane and click the 'Add Layout' button. Use the default name, 'Layout1'.
Click the Add Line button.
In the 'Edit Layout Line' dialog click the 'Add' button under the 'Middle' section, select 'Buttonlist1', and click OK.
Click OK to Close the ControlBar Builder and highlight [PanelHeader End: PANELHEADER_1]. Open the 'Other Controls' menu and click on [Button] to add a button control underneath the Panel Header.
In the properties list's Button Properties' section set the 'Button text' property to read 'Set Button-list Selection'.
